metadata.title: CVE-2022-41222 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.description:
mm/mremap.c in the Linux kernel before 5.13.3 has a use-after-free via astale TLB because an rmap lock is not held during a PUD move.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-132-generic - 5.4.0-132.148
linux-image-5.4.0-132-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-132.148
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-132-generic - 5.4.0-132.148
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-132-lowlatency - 5.4.0-132.148
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1089-aws - 5.4.0-1089.97
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1014-aws - 5.15.0-1014.18~20.04.1
No subscription required
